text: Staged pages are not included in HubSpot reporting/analytics, correct?
I'm searching for documentation on this question and can't seem to find it anywhere.
anything from that domain should not be reported on
hi community, one cuestion, is it posible to make templates for the drag and drop email function in HubSpot?
is there a way to upload CMS assets (js, css, ect) that makes them immutable (long live cache control headers, ect)?
add to calendar buttons in emails -- does someone have a resource for this? I have a client asking and I don't really mess with emails like that anymore
what do you mean long live cache control headers...
CSS/JS files currently have cache headers `*cache-control:* s-maxage=1814400, max-age=1209600, stale-while-revalidate=900`
Just looking at an example in my account
Yeah, that was kind of my question, I felt like it was "long life" but I wasn't sure what exactly was being asked.. can you clarify <@UVCQGSL2C>
does anyone here have experience with segment's integration with HubSpot as the destination?
FWIW, I’ve generally avoided it because I’m not a fan of the HS analytics event model. But is there a specific question you had in mind?

yea sry i saw that after posting myself... so in my experiance you can do "sane" ttls for assets uploaded, but thats shaky since someone could "modify" the asset and have to wait 1209600 sec (according to the above rule) for users to get the new version... so usually you need to rely on versioning or fingerprinting, in which case you can apply `cache-control: max-age=300000, immutable, public` which performs many great optimizations for UX
i was hoping there was some sort of rule (put immutable assets under `/static` directory or follow this naming convention... ect) that I could opt in to such a header

I see. Yeah I am trying to understand how come specific HubSpot campaign aren't recording sessions when a user enters the landing page with utm_campaign query params and with Segment set up on that page with HubSpot as a destination.
